definition[0]: someone who is not one of the two main people involved in an agreement or legal case, but who is affected by it or involved in it in some way
definition[1]: someone who is not one of the two main people or organizations involved in an agreement or legal case
example[0]: The preference tests were conducted by an independent third party.
definition[2]: in an insurance contract, someone who is not the insurer or the insured person, but who will get money if the insured person causes them loss or injury
example[1]: The insurance only covers loss or injury to a third party.
